definition.name: bump-homebrew-formula
definition.description: Bump Homebrew formula after a new release
definition.author: @mislav

inputs.name: formula-name
inputs.description: The name of the Homebrew formula (defaults to lower-cased repository name)

inputs.name: formula-path
inputs.description: The path to the Homebrew formula file (defaults to `Formula/<formula-name>.rb`)

inputs.name: tag-name
inputs.description: The git tag name to bump the formula to (defaults to the currently pushed tag)

inputs.name: download-url
inputs.description: The package download URL for the Homebrew formula (defaults to the release tarball)

inputs.name: download-sha256
inputs.description: The SHA256 checksum of the archive at download-url (defaults to calculating it)

inputs.name: homebrew-tap
inputs.description: The repository where the formula should be updated

inputs.name: push-to
inputs.description: An existing fork of the homebrew-tap repository where the edit should be pushed to (defaults to creating or reusing a personal fork)

inputs.name: base-branch
inputs.description: The branch name in the homebrew-tap repository to update the formula in

inputs.name: create-pullrequest
inputs.description: Set to a boolean value to either force or prohibit making a pull request to homebrew-tap

inputs.name: create-branch
inputs.description: Set to a boolean value to either force or prohibit creating a separate branch on homebrew-tap

inputs.name: commit-message
inputs.description: The git commit message template to use when updating the formula

evidence.reasoning: This action is designed to update Homebrew formulas, which is a deployment-related task, and it involves packaging the software for distribution via Homebrew.
